{{cpp/title|fputwc}}
{{cpp/io/c/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|cwchar}}
{{dcl|num=1|
std::wint_t fputwc( wchar_t ch, std::FILE* stream );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|
std::wint_t putwc( wchar_t ch, std::FILE* stream );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Writes a wide character {{c|ch}} to the given output stream {{c|stream}}.
@2@ May be implemented as a macro and may evaluate {{c|stream}} more than once.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|wide character to be written}}
{{par|stream|the output stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|ch}} on success, {{lc|WEOF}} on failure. If an encoding error occurs, {{lc|errno}} is set to {{lc|EILSEQ}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cerrno&gt;
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;cstdio&gt;
#include &lt;cstdlib&gt;
#include &lt;cwchar&gt;
#include &lt;initializer_list&gt;

int main()
{
    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.utf8");

    for (const wchar_t ch :
    {
        L'\u2200', // Unicode name: "FOR ALL"
        L'\n',
        L'∀',
    })
    {
        if (errno = 0; std::fputwc(ch, stdout) == WEOF)
        {
            std::puts(errno == EILSEQ
                ? "Encoding error in fputwc"
                : "I/O error in fputwc"
            );
            return EXIT_FAILURE;
        }
    }
    return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}
|p=true
|output=
∀
∀
}}
